Detailed Description

(blackadder Core) ActiveSubscription represents an active subscription of an application or click element or another Linux module.

It can be either a scope or an information item. The LocalProxy only handles active subscriptions.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ActiveSubscription::ActiveSubscription ( String  _fullID,
unsigned char  _strategy,
bool  _isScope 
)

Constructor: It constructs an ActiveSubscription object using the provided values.

Parameters:
_fullID the full identifier of the subscribed scope or item, which has size of PURSUIT_ID_LEN * number of fragments in the graph. Therefore it is the identifier starting from a root of the information graph. LocalProxy does not know the information graph. Only RV elements know the graphs for which they are rendezvous points.
_strategy the dissemination strategy assigned to this subscription.
_isScope is it a scope?

Member Data Documentation

Vector<String> ActiveSubscription::allKnownIDs

A vector of Strings with which this scope or information item is known to this LocalProxy. Initially each item is only known by the identifier provided by the application.

As events regarding this scope or item arrive (e.g. start/stop publish or new/deleted scope) the LocalProxy assigns more IDs to this (if there are any). The Local Proxy does not know the structure so it only learns identifiers by pub/sub events.

BABitvector ActiveSubscription::RVFID

The LIPSIN identifier to the node that is the rendevous point in respect to the assigned strategy.

It can be the internal Link Identifier is the strategy is NODE_LOCAL or a preconfigured FID to the domain's rendezvous.

LocalHostSet ActiveSubscription::subscribers

A Click HashTable<LocalHostSetItem> (see common.hh). It is the way sets can be implemented using click-compatible code.

It contains all applications and click elements that are subscribed to this scope or item.
